page.title: 12MILTON'S MOBILE SHOPS.
page.content: Home Life in the village of Milton differs from that in towns.We studied services to villages and concentrated on the mobile shops.Those without cars depend on these or the Post Office/ shop for food.Prices are dearer than in Markinch 4kms away or Glenrothes 7km west,but bus fares cost 46p single for adults,half for children.The Co-op van brings{rolls and milk}every morning,then{bakery goods}and a few {groceries}three times each week.Green (butcher) and the Co-op bring{meat}3 days each.A{greengrocer}calls Monday, Wednesday and Friday and the{fish}man Tuesday,Thursday and Saturday.The{fish {and chip}van comes on Friday nights. {Ice cream}vans call every evening. Milton has a pub,primary school,church and village hall,but no doctor,dentist or nurse,and no bank or any shop.
